attacks.name: Heap Up
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for all Energy cards and show them to your opponent. If you find any Metal Special Energy cards there this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. Put all of those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hard Metal
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Aggron does 40 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Power Cancel
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, when your opponent's Pokémon uses any Poké-Power, you may discard 2 cards from your hand and prevent all effects of that Poké-Power. (This counts as that Pokémon using its Poké-Power.) This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Alakazam by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Tail Influence
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin until he or she gets heads. For each tails, remove an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put it on the bottom of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Charity Tail
attacks.text: Before Ambipom does damage, your opponent may discard 2 cards from his or her hand. If he or she does, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 80.

abilities.name: Downer Material
abilities.text: If you have Uxie and Mesprit in play, the attack cost of each of your opponent's Basic Pokémon's attacks is Colorless more. You can't use more than 1 Downer Material Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Bind Pulse
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards from his or her hand to any of his or her Pokémon.

abilities.name: Kind Egg
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Happiny is anywhere under Blissey, you may choose a number of cards in your hand up to the amount of Energy attached to Blissey and put those cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, draw that many cards. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Happy Chance
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 for each Energy attached to Blissey. Before doing damage, you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Blissey.

abilities.name: Miracle Oracle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. Then, discard a card from your hand. If you discard an Energy card, draw 1 more card. This power can't be used if Bronzong is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shady Stamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Leaf Tornado
attacks.text: You may move any number of basic Grass Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Energy Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Breaking Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

abilities.name: Rainbow Scale
abilities.text: If an Active Pokémon has Weakness to any of the types of Energy attached to Garchomp, Garchomp's attacks do 40 more damage to that Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Rainbow Scale Poké-Body can't be used if Garchomp has any Special Energy cards attached to it.

abilities.name: Dark Genes
abilities.text: As long as Honchkrow has the Energy necessary to use its attack, each of your Murkrow can use Honchkrow's attack as its own without the Energy necessary to use that attack.

attacks.name: Dark Wing Flaps
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

abilities.name: Lure Ring
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lumineon is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has a maximum HP of 100 or more and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Lumineon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Reverse Stream
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lumineon. Then, return all Water Energy attached to Lumineon to your hand.

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Flame Drum
attacks.text: If Magby isn't anywhere under Magmortar, discard 2 Energy cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 Energy cards from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Ultra Powder
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If the first coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the second coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If the third coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Counterattack
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Fire Pokémon in play, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Upper Material
abilities.text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, the Retreat Cost for each Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf (both yours and your opponent's) is 0.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: You may switch Mesprit with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Explosive Thunder
attacks.text: Discard all basic Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded.

abilities.name: Firestarter
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Evaporating Heat
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage and discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Ground Burn
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 80 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

abilities.name: Memory Out
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Uxie is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Uxie is Knocked Out), you may use this power. The Attacking Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Mind Off
attacks.text: If you have Mesprit and Azelf in play, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Glacier Snow
abilities.text: If Abomasnow is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Abomasnow is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Heavy Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Sticky
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each player's Pokémon (excluding Ariados) is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Offensive Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Protective Wall
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Anger Revenge
attacks.text: If Bastiodon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Call In
attacks.text: Draw a card. If Chingling is anywhere under Chimecho, draw 2 more cards.

attacks.name: Strange Bell
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, that Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Toxic
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Crobat from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Strike and Fade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If tails, shuffle Crobat and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

attacks.name: String Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each basic Energy card attached to Exeggutor and to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Nutritional Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Craggy Face
abilities.text: As long as Glalie is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Intimidation Pebble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards or Supporter cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Dragon DNA
abilities.text: Gyarados can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) If Gyarados uses any attack from its Basic Pokémon, that attack does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Enrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. If the first coin is tails, Gyarados is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sore Performance
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Concerto
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Kricketot and each Kricketune you have in play.

attacks.name: Lightning Twister
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of basic Energy cards attached to Manectric.

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that is the same type as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Jumbo Fin
abilities.text: If Mantyke is anywhere under Mantine, the Retreat Cost for each of your Water Pokémon is ColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: Mantine can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

abilities.name: Airy Wall
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon that has 2 or less Energy cards attached to it attacks Mr. Mime, prevent all damage done to Mr. Mime from that attack. If Mime Jr. is anywhere under Mr. Mime, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Mr. Mime.

attacks.name: Trick Play
attacks.text: Put a coin next to your Active Pokémon without showing your opponent and cover it with your hand. Your opponent guesses if the coin is heads or tails. If he or she is wrong, this attack does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If he or she is right, Mr. Mime does 20 damage to itself, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

abilities.name: Mother Pheromone
abilities.text: The attack cost of your Nidoran ♀, Nidorina, Nidoran ♂, Nidorino, and Nidoking's attacks is Colorless less.

attacks.name: Give Aid
attacks.text: If you have the same number of or less Benched Pokémon than your opponent, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 90.

abilities.name: Color Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Ninetales is the same type as that Pokémon (all if that Pokémon is more than 1 type) until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Ninetales.

attacks.name: Assurance
attacks.text: As long as the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP is 60 or less, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

attacks.name: Hasty Headbutt
attacks.text: Rampardos does 20 damage to itself. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Energetic Impulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Slaking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, Slaking's Lazy Blow attack's base damage is 130 during this turn. If tails, Slaking can't attack or retreat during this turn. (If Slaking is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

attacks.name: Sidestep
attacks.text: If Bonsly is anywhere under Sudowoodo, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Sudowoodo during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Persuade
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Poison Sacs
abilities.text: Your opponent can't remove the Special Condition Poisoned by evolving or devolving his or her Poisoned Pokémon. (This also includes putting a Pokémon Level-Up card onto the Poisoned Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Knuckle Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: ITEM
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown I, Unown T, Unown E, and Unown M on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 ITEM Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put it face down. Treat that card as a Special Energy card that provides Colorless Energy and doesn't have any effect other than providing Energy. Put that card face up at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Bad Temper
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Defensive Claw
attacks.text: If Teddiursa is on your Bench, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage. If Teddiursa is on your Bench and has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage and remove all damage counters from that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Freeze-up
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Walrein from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may flip 2 coins. If both are heads, discard 1 of the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ice Bind
attacks.text: If your opponent doesn't discard a card from his or her hand, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fury
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Whiscash.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Evolution Impulse
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Leaf Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chimecho from your hand onto Chingling (this counts as evolving Chingling) and remove all damage counters from Chingling. 0 Inviting Bell Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Steamroll
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Evolutionary Vitality
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Croconaw from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose all Energy cards you find there, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hover Over
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Cold Fat
abilities.text: As long as Dewgong is Asleep, any damage done to Dewgong by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Dewgong is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Triple Pick
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Gather Up
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Marvelous Shine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads put 4 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, remove 4 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crane Neck
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Pulse Search
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny. 0 Lively Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mend
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Lairon. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from Lairon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Magmar.

attacks.name: Centrifugal Force
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

attacks.name: Swirling Ripple
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Water Pokémon in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Rescue
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Crash Bomber
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Then, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Liner
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Wild Spores
attacks.text: If Parasect evolved from Paras during this turn, this attack does 40 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Extend Fungus
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Parasect.

attacks.name: Pressurized Gas
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Pupitar does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Pupitar by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Quilava.

attacks.name: Spike Armor
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Sandslash is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sandslash is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Spike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, that Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Ice Rider
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hard Face
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Shieldon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shield Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Bonus Leaf
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: EQUIP
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown E is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown E and attach Unown E to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. As long as Unown E is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon gets +10 HP.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever your opponent flips a coin, treat it as tails.

abilities.name: MAGNET
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown M is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Unown M is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

abilities.name: THROW
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown T is your Active Pokémon, you may discard a card from your hand. Then, flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Unown T is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck. Then, show your opponent your hand and he or she chooses 1 card. Shuffle that card into your deck.

attacks.name: Wake-up Punch
attacks.text: If Vigoroth evolved from Slakoth during this turn and Slakoth was Asleep, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 10.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Play Search
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other 4 cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ultra Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for Alakazam and put it on Abra (this counts as evolving Abra). Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Throw Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Tackle
attacks.text: Aron does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Mud Spit
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dull Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey does 60 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Ghastly Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Finger Poke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Accelerating Stab
attacks.text: Doduo can't use Accelerating Stab during your next turn.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Jam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach any Energy cards from his or her hand to the Active Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Direct-hit Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Exeggcute. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. For each heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Elegant Swim
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Finneon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Stone Throw
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Mountain Bite
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage and Larvitar is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Magmar from your hand onto Magby (this counts as evolving Magby) and remove all damage counters from Magby. 0 Scorch Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Hide Crowd
attacks.text: Switch Murkrow with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for Nidoran ♂ or Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Mushroom Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu. 0 Chupi 20 Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Electro Recycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Pichu is anywhere under Pikachu, you may search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Pikachu is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: BikaBika
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Numbing Water
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Freezing Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Shinx.

attacks.name: Drowsy
attacks.text: Both Slakoth and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Snowball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Snowball Fight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Snover does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Willpower
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your next turn, Spheal's Rollout attack's base damage is 40.

attacks.name: Impound
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 2 damage counters from Teddiursa. Teddiursa is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sweet Palm
attacks.text: Before doing damage, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shining Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Soul
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Bebe's Search
rules: Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Dusk Ball
rules: Look at the 7 cards from the bottom of your deck. Choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put the remaining cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Fossil Excavator
rules: Search your deck or discard pile for a Trainer card that has Fossil in its name or a Stage 1 or Stage 2 Evolution card that evolves from a Fossil. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. If you searched your deck, shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Lake Boundary
rules: Apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×2 instead.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Night Maintenance
rules: Search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Quick Ball
rules: You can play this card only if you discard another card from your hand.Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Team Galactic's Wager
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, and you and your opponent play "Rock-Paper-Scissors." The player who wins draws up to 6 cards. The player who loses draws up to 3 cards. (You draw your cards first.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Armor Fossil

abilities.name: Armor Stone
abilities.text: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10. Illustrated by Ryo Ueda

rules: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Skull Fossil

abilities.name: Skull Stone
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Skull Fossil would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon. Illustrated by Ryo Ueda

rules: During your opponent's turn, if Skull Fossil would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

abilities.name: Shocking Tail
abilities.text: As long as Electivire is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pulse Barrier
attacks.text: Discard all of your opponent's Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play. If you do, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Electivire during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Stance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Lucario LV.X from your hand onto your Active Lucario, you may use this power. Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Lucario during your opponent's next turn. (If Lucario is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lucario by attacks is increased by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Torrid Wave
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Magmortar is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 2 on that Pokémon between turns. This power can't be used if Magmortar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flame Bluster
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Magmortar. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) During your next turn, Magmortar can't use Flame Bluster.

name: Time
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
